questionText: What happens to a Move package once it is published on-chain on the IOTA network?

answerOptions.answerText: It becomes immutable and cannot be directly altered.
It can be modified by its owner at any time.
It is automatically upgraded to the latest version.
It is hidden from other users.

questionText: How can you upgrade a Move package on IOTA without affecting existing dependencies?

answerOptions.answerText: By modifying the original package directly.
By creating a new package object with improved or additional code.
By deleting the old package and replacing it.

questionText: What is the purpose of the UpgradeCap object in the IOTA package upgrade process?

answerOptions.answerText: It allows you to make a package immutable.
It grants ownership and permission to upgrade a package.
It stores the package's version history.
It prevents other users from accessing the package.

questionText: What is a consequence of making a package immutable using iota::package::make_immutable?

answerOptions.answerText: You can no longer fix bugs or introduce new features.
The package can still be upgraded using the UpgradeCap.
The package automatically updates to the latest version.
Other packages depending on it will stop working.
